embeds.title: Prismatic Barrier
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 2 (3) **Block** :p_block: for each **Gem** in this card.
[ **Socket** ]
[ **Socket** ]
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: place to put excess gems
horrible without excess gems
pretty decent when filled
this card got nerfed last guardian patch. what a world we live in
what was It before?
what is the ideal prismatic combo
dex + 2 wards?
its energy + energy + energy
temp buffs don't work on this immediately
okay way to dodge the question
good job
there's ruby + emerald + oynx making this self scaling block that uses dex 3 times
there's also emerald oynx oynx giving you two dex every use aka + 6 block
on subsequent uses

this card nerf hit it bad, it used to get +4 (when upgraded) for each gem which made is a lot stronger. It still works as a card used to stockpile gems in; but now its weaker then most other options that accomplish that like exploit gems, bubble barrier and suspension. Its still sometimes pickable when you have gem cannon though which was its main use before. Its just that now its really hard to justify taking this if your not planning on gem cannon abuse.

due to the situation you want to take this (treating it as a sudo card removal to store 3 gems in 1 card so you can draw your gem cannon faster) it does not really matter what gems you stuff inside as long as something is in there. Since each gem is 10 damage you just want as many as possible so you can ohko the act 3 bosses

This is a really strange card, at first I thought the nerf really hit hard. With max gems it went from 6(12) block to 6(9) block which is pretty bad. However that definitely isn't telling the whole story. You also have 3 gem effects so this has a lot more effects, ones that you tailor made. Secondly, this not just double scales with dexterity, it triple scales with it, and there are no other cards that can do this on Guardian (honorable mention to <stasis field> which *kinda* does)

embeds.title: Stasis Field
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
Place this into Stasis
When this leaves Stasis, gain 6 (8) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: This unique factor stacked with defensive mode can be an extremely strong late game block engine. I've had times where this card was responsible for 60 block. This card works because it has a niche of a multi-block to scale dex. It's why <prismatic spray> is, in my opinion, one of the worst cards on the guardian. It does not have the niche of being the only multihit.

embeds.title: Prismatic Spray
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Deal 3 (4) damage for each **Gem** in this card.
[ **Socket** ]
[ **Socket** ]
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: It is 9(12) damage with gems which isn't bad, but both the prismatic cards share a massive weakness I have neglected to bring up until now. They are absolute garbage for a decent amount of time. You cannot just add them to your deck whenever, they do nothing when added, and require you to take more low impact cards for them to come online. For that amount of setup, they really need to ahve something special to be worth taking. a 3x dex payoff is something special. a 3x strength multihit is not.

Compared to other block cards, I can clearly see use cases where I'd want prismatic barrier. It takes a while to come online but it has nothing close to it when it comes to dex stacking payoffs. Prismatic spray isn't even the best strength payoff.
poly beam go brrr
but yeah
barrier fine
bc usually u pick it when you have some dex gain in deck
Question: when do you guys usually take barrier?
when i get it from pandora's box
lmao fair point, I usually take every card from Pandora's
either pandora's or when I have massive excess of gems

Yeah I usually take it when I have gems and other cards with open sockets that I was planning on socketing in those other cards. I'll take it and path to a campfire, possibly closer than the one I was originally planning to go to, and I'll socket 3 gems and just start looking for more gems to fill the extra sockets from the other cards. I almost never take it raw unless my deck is that strong (aka gem cannon and a lot of draw)

i normally don’t have raw gems unless:
transforms
pickaxe
rares or quartz
searching for the right completion gem for twin slam/bauble(shiv+str, ward+dex mostly?) I might also have a raw brace or thorns if started with it
<sack of gems>?

if it’s just randomly gotten
i don’t think a lot of people run around with 3+ loose gems so barrier is generally a decent risk
instead of buying sack of gems, buy astrolabe, does sack of gems job better
imo, it's better to have 5~ synergistic gems than 10 random gems that are merely just socketed
that’s also generally my opinion
if i pick up a vent steam, I’m gonna want rubies or shiv or garnet to put in it usually
also what, buy astrolabe?

yeah orrery
lol
mb
but yeah sack of gems has the major issue of just not letting you skip vs orrery
